definition: to accumulate/to hold in store/to contain/to gather together/to collect/depth/inner strength/profundity
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Many of the deposits are too small, too impure .
sentences.chinese: 许多蕴藏量太小，质地太不纯。

sentences.english: The area is abundant in petroleum deposits.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区石油蕴藏量丰富。

sentences.english: But proven reserves are only estimates and not fixed numbers.
sentences.chinese: 不过，证实的蕴藏量其实只是估计值，并非确切数字。

sentences.english: Shanxi is rich in hydropower resources and considerable amount of it can be developed technologically.
sentences.chinese: 山西省境内水电资源蕴藏量丰富，技术可开发量可观。

sentences.english: Indonesia is abundant in petroleum deposits.
sentences.chinese: 印尼的石油蕴藏量丰富。

sentences.english: Exocarpium Juglandis Immaturum produces mainly in the three northeastern provinces and Heilongjiang Province resources reserves is the largest.
sentences.chinese: 青龙衣主产于东北三省，以黑龙江省资源蕴藏量最大。

definition: remaining quantity/reserves (of natural resources, oil etc)
